column1: You have pneumonia, which is an infection in your lungs.
They also gave you medicine to help your body get rid of the germs that cause pneumonia.

Other things that may also help include: - Placing a warm, wet washcloth loosely over your nose and mouth - Filling a humidifier with warm water and breathing in the warm mist Coughing helps clear your airways.
Your doctor may tell you to take antibiotics.
These are medicines that kill the germs that cause pneumonia.
Coughing helps your body get rid of mucus from your lungs.
Your doctor or nurse will tell you if it is OK to use acetaminophen (Tylenol) or ibuprofen (Advil or Motrin) for fever or pain.
